summary.long: Philippians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus,
To all the saints in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with the overseers and deacons:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank my God in all my remembrance of you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always in every prayer of mine for you all making my prayer with joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I am sure of this, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is right for me to feel this way about you all, because I hold you in my heart, for you are all partakers with me of grace, both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is my witness, how I yearn for you all with the affection of Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is my prayer that your love may abound more and more, with knowledge and all discernment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may approve what is excellent, and so be pure and blameless for the day of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: filled with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want you to know, brothers, that what has happened to me has really served to advance the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that it has become known throughout the whole imperial guard and to all the rest that my imprisonment is for Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And most of the brothers, having become confident in the Lord by my imprisonment, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some indeed preach Christ from envy and rivalry, but others from good will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The latter do it out of love, knowing that I am put here for the defense of the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The former proclaim Christ out of selfish ambition, not sincerely but thinking to afflict me in my imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What then? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is proclaimed, and in that I rejoice.
Yes, and I will rejoice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I know that through your prayers and the help of the Spirit of Jesus Christ this will turn out for my deliverance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as it is my eager expectation and hope that I will not be at all ashamed, but that with full courage now as always Christ will be honored in my body, whether by life or by death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I am to live in the flesh, that means fruitful labor for me. Yet which I shall choose I cannot tell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am hard pressed between the two. My desire is to depart and be with Christ, for that is far better.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to remain in the flesh is more necessary on your account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Convinced of this, I know that I will remain and continue with you all, for your progress and joy in the faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that in me you may have ample cause to glory in Christ Jesus, because of my coming to you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only let your manner of life be worthy of the gospel of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or am absent, I may hear of you that you are standing firm in one spirit, with one mind striving side by side for the faith of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not frightened in anything by your opponents. This is a clear sign to them of their destruction, but of your salvation, and that from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it has been granted to you that for the sake of Christ you should not only believe in him but also suffer for his sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: engaged in the same conflict that you saw I had and now hear that I still have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if there is any encouragement in Christ, any comfort from love, any participation in the Spirit, any affection and sympathy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: complete my joy by being of the same mind, having the same love, being in full accord and of one mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let each of you look not only to his own interests, but also to the interests of others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have this mind among yourselves, which is yours in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, though he was in the form of God, did not count equality with God a thing to be grasped,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but emptied himself, by taking the form of a servant, being born in the likeness of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And being found in human form, he humbled himself by becoming obedient to the point of death, even death on a cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore God has highly exalted him and bestowed on him the name that is above every name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my beloved, as you have always obeyed, so now, not only as in my presence but much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is God who works in you, both to will and to work for his good pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do all things without grumbling or disputing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may be blameless and innocent, children of God without blemish in the midst of a crooked and twisted generation, among whom you shine as lights in the world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding fast to the word of life, so that in the day of Christ I may be proud that I did not run in vain or labor in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if I am to be poured out as a drink offering upon the sacrificial offering of your faith, I am glad and rejoice with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise you also should be glad and rejoice with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, so that I too may be cheered by news of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have no one like him, who will be genuinely concerned for your welfare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they all seek their own interests, not those of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you know Timothy's proven worth, how as a son with a father he has served with me in the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hope therefore to send him just as soon as I see how it will go with me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I trust in the Lord that shortly I myself will come also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have thought it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus my brother and fellow worker and fellow soldier, and your messenger and minister to my need,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he has been longing for you all and has been distressed because you heard that he was ill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed he was ill, near to death. But God had mercy on him, and not only on him but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the more eager to send him, therefore, that you may rejoice at seeing him again, and that I may be less anxious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So receive him in the Lord with all joy, and honor such men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he nearly died for the work of Christ, risking his life to complete what was lacking in your service to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you is no trouble to me and is safe for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look out for the dogs, look out for the evildoers, look out for those who mutilate the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are the circumcision, who worship by the Spirit of God and glory in Christ Jesus and put no confidence in the flesh—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though I myself have reason for confidence in the flesh also. If anyone else thinks he has reason for confidence in the flesh, I have more:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: circumcised on the eighth day, of the people of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew of Hebrews; as to the law, a Pharisee;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as to zeal, a persecutor of the church; as to righteousness under the law, blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whatever gain I had, I counted as loss for the sake of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, I count everything as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. For his sake I have suffered the loss of all things and count them as rubbish, in order that I may gain Christ
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and be found in him, not having a righteousness of my own that comes from the law, but that which comes through faith in Christ, the righteousness from God that depends on faith—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may know him and the power of his resurrection, and may share his sufferings, becoming like him in his death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that by any means possible I may attain the resurrection from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that I have already obtained this or am already perfect, but I press on to make it my own, because Christ Jesus has made me his own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, I do not consider that I have made it my own. But one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let those of us who are mature think this way, and if in anything you think otherwise, God will reveal that also to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only let us hold true to what we have attained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brothers, join in imitating me, and keep your eyes on those who walk according to the example you have in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many, of whom I have often told you and now tell you even with tears, walk as enemies of the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their end is destruction, their god is their belly, and they glory in their shame, with minds set on earthly things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But our citizenship is in heaven, and from it we await a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who will transform our lowly body to be like his glorious body, by the power that enables him even to subject all things to himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my brothers, whom I love and long for, my joy and crown, stand firm thus in the Lord, my beloved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I entreat Euodia and I entreat Syntyche to agree in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I ask you also, true companion, help these women, who have labored side by side with me in the gospel together with Clement and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the book of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I will say, rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your reasonableness be known to everyone. The Lord is at hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence, if there is anything worthy of praise, think about these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What you have learned and received and heard and seen in me—practice these things, and the God of peace will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at length you have revived your concern for me. You were indeed concerned for me, but you had no opportunity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that I am speaking of being in need, for I have learned in whatever situation I am to be content.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know how to be brought low, and I know how to abound. In any and every circumstance, I have learned the secret of facing plenty and hunger, abundance and need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet it was kind of you to share my trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you Philippians yourselves know that in the beginning of the gospel, when I left Macedonia, no church entered into partnership with me in giving and receiving, except you only.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even in Thessalonica you sent me help for my needs once and again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that I seek the gift, but I seek the fruit that increases to your credit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have received full payment, and more. I am well supplied, having received from Epaphroditus the gifts you sent, a fragrant offering, a sacrifice acceptable and pleasing to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my God will supply every need of yours according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To our God and Father be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the saints greet you, especially those of Caesar's household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
